# Special Inspections Program

Special inspections are required by the current building code and are outlined in the links below. The Fairfax County Special Inspections Program (SIP), established in 1973 after the collapse of a 26-story concrete building under construction, monitors all major commercial and residential construction projects.

Special inspections are observations, inspections and tests conducted during the construction of a building which require particular expertise to substantiate adequacy. The owner must retain a Registered Design Professional to provide these services, and bears the associated costs.

_**Note:** A pre-construction meeting and a critical structures meeting are the same thing and referred to as both in the program manual, Web page and in PLUS._

Special inspections Program Publication 2021 

Special inspections Program Publication 2018 

## Special Inspection Meeting with Critical Structures Section

**Before requesting a pre-construction meeting** , create a CRIT record and link it to the associated building record if it is subject to the SIP. Helpful video available on YouTube.

Request Pre-construction Meeting

## Special Inspection Publication and Forms

  * Special inspections Program Publication 2021
  * Special inspections Program Publication 2018
  * Final Report of Special Inspections
  * Formwork/Shoring/Stripping/Stressing Authorization Request
  * Cold Weather Concrete Slab Temperature Log



## Related Resources

  * Use the GIS Critical Structures Section Inspection Areas to track who your designated critical structure inspector is, based on your address.


  * Please refer to Guidelines for Smoke Control Manual for all design, commissioning, and additional testing requirements. Where conflict occurs, Special Inspection Program (SIP) shall take precedence. If you have questions with regards to this manual, please call Fairfax County Fire Marshal Office, Engineering Plans Review Division, at 703-246-4806, TTY 711, or by email.
